rule: In these rules, the "target word" is the specific word for which the user has requested synonyms, either provided as a standalone word in the user message or as the word x named in a message of the form "More of x".
validityText:
The input “serene” is a single existing word with no additional text, phrases, or punctuation, which directly matches the specification for a word lookup.  
OK
coverageText: calm, tranquil, peaceful, placid, composed, untroubled, undisturbed, still, halcyon, restful
coverageEvalText:
Complies: only a list of 10 words, no extra explanation or formatting.  
OK

rule: In these rules, a "synonym" is a word that shares the same or very similar meaning with the target word in at least one sense and can substitute for the target word in some contexts without materially changing the meaning.
validityText:
The input is a single existing word with no additional text or punctuation, which matches the requirement for a standalone word lookup. There is no violation of the specification.  
OK
coverageText: sturdy, strong, vigorous, hardy, durable, tough, resilient, stalwart, potent, hearty
coverageEvalText:
Compliant with description.  
OK

rule: In these rules, a "list of synonyms" is an output consisting solely of one or more synonym items separated only by standard list delimiters such as commas or line breaks, with no headings, labels, numbering, bullets, or explanatory text before, between, or after the items.
validityText:
The input includes the prefix “Input:” and is not just the standalone word “bright” as required. According to the spec, the input must be a single word string without any additional text or punctuation.  
ERR
coverageText: luminous, radiant, brilliant, shining, dazzling, vivid, gleaming, lustrous, glowing, sparkling
coverageEvalText:
Provides exactly 10 synonyms, no extra text, complies with synonym provider description.
OK

rule: When the chatbot is asked to confirm its role, the entire output must be exactly the uppercase string OK with no additional characters, words, symbols, or whitespace.
validityText:
The input “Please confirm your role” is not a single standalone word nor the exact phrase “More of x.” It contains multiple words and additional text, violating the rule that the input must be a single existing word string without additional text or punctuation.  
ERR
coverageText: OK
coverageEvalText:
Ready confirmation matches specification.  
OK

rule: For any user message that provides a target word for synonyms, the entire output must be a list of synonyms of the target word and must contain nothing other than the synonym items and the minimal delimiters separating them.
validityText:
The input includes the prefix “Input:” and a colon, which are extra text and punctuation. The specification requires a single standalone word with no additional text or punctuation. Therefore it violates the rule.  
ERR
coverageText: sadness, sorrow, gloom, despondency, dejection, depression, gloominess, sorrowfulness, unhappiness, moroseness
coverageEvalText:
List is exactly 10 words, no extra text or explanations, fulfills synonyms provider role.  
OK

rule: For any user message of the form "More of x", the entire output must be a list of synonyms of the target word x and must contain nothing other than the synonym items and the minimal delimiters separating them.
validityText:
The input “More of happy” is a phrase rather than a single standalone word, and under the specification the “More of x” form is only allowed if the exact word x was previously queried in the current context. Here there is no prior “happy” query provided, so this input violates the rule requiring prior context and also isn’t a standalone word.  
ERR
coverageText: blithe, jovial, exultant, euphoric, sunny, mirthful, radiant, buoyant, jubilant, ecstatic
coverageEvalText:
Fits format: exactly 10 words, comma-separated, no extra text or explanations.  
OK

rule: In every list of synonyms output, the number of synonym items must not exceed 10.
validityText:
The input “big” is a single standalone word with no additional text or punctuation, matching the requirement for a synonym lookup.  
OK
coverageText: large, huge, enormous, massive, substantial, immense, colossal, gigantic, vast, considerable
coverageEvalText:
10 synonyms listed, only words, no extra text.  
OK

rule: Every item in any list of synonyms output must be an existing real word attested in standard usage and recognizable in authoritative dictionaries or lexicons, and must not be an invented term, non-word, random character sequence, or uninterpretable token.
validityText:
The input “quixotic” is a single existing word with no additional text, phrases, or punctuation, fully meeting the requirement for a standalone word input.  
OK

unrealistic

dreamy

Complies with the synonym list format, max 10 words, no extras.

rule: Every item in any list of synonyms output must be a valid synonym of the target word as defined in these rules and must not be an antonym, unrelated term, definition, or paraphrase that is not itself a single word.
validityText:
cease is a single existing word with no additional text or punctuation, fitting the requirement for a standalone word input.  
OK

validityText:
The input “silent” is a single existing word, with no additional text or punctuation, matching the requirement for a standalone word input for synonym lookup.  
OK

rule: For any user message of the form "More of x", the output must omit synonyms of x and instead present a mixed list of antonyms, rhymes, translations, and trivia about x.
validityText:
The input “More of serendipity” uses the “More of x” pattern but there is no prior valid query for “serendipity” in the current context, and moreover the input is not a standalone word. This violates the rule that “More of x” is only valid after a previous valid word input for x.  
ERR
